page.title: 09GOONHILLY NATURE RESERVE
page.content: The Heath plant populations vary according to drainage and soil, the serpentine soil have the greatest control over the magnificent variety of plants.Although more than{140} vascular plants have been identified on local heathland, ten plants play a vital role: {Bristle Bent (Agrostis setacea), {Cornish heath,Heather,Bell Heather, {Cross-leaved heath, Bog Rush(Schoenus {nigricans), Gorse, Purple Moor Grass {(Molinia coenilae), Sheeps Fescue and {Western Gorse (Ulex gallii).}All the heath area contains these plants in varying numbers, each producing a unique habitat. Experts from all over the World come to this area to examine these plants and plant communities. Botanists will note in the{list}many extremely rare plants.The number of clovers and sedges is notable.
